moves.1. e4 c5 2. Bc4 g6 3. Qf3 e6 4. d3 Qf6: of course, this is a blatent bluff: Black has no better than Nc6, Nd2, Ne5, Qg3...
moves.5. c3: for now, this bluff worked really nicely: after just Nc3, Nc6, Qg3, or Qg3, Nc6, Nc3, White is already better...
moves.5... Qxf3: certainly, not the best of continuations: after Nc6, Bf4, a6, Nd2, d6, 0-0-0, Black has a lot of sins to contemplate...
moves.6. Nxf3 Bg7: at this point, Black should really consider Ne7, Bg5, Bg7: but we are on a mission; Ne7 will come in due time, and after Bg5 I usually plan f6...
moves.7. Ng5: luckily, not the best move for White: some players, still think that this motif works in some way; however, after Ne7, followed by d5, this dream is over... better here, is Bf4, Ne7, Bd6!, Nbc6, 0-0, b6, and take it from there...
moves.7... Ne7 8. Na3: admitting, 5. c3, was a bad move; we have to be careful now, because White is preparing Nb5 threatening both Nc7 (losing Ra8) or Nd6 possibly with check; castling is no option, due to Nc7...
moves.8... a6: forced, but always sound in most Sicilian play: the good old Najdorf extension; both b5 and d5, are now issues...
moves.9. b4: after just Bb3/Bf4, d5, Bf4/Bb3, or 0-0, d5, or Be3, d5 - or virtually any move, followed by d5 - there was not much happening: this all is just just Sicilian development; this move however, can only happen in blitz...
moves.9... cxb4: at this point, I realized that cxb4 would result in Bxa1: totally missing, that Bxc3+ is already winning; this too, is not uncommon in blitz games: totally missing the winning move......
moves.10. Nc2: Nb1, bxc3, Na3, c2, Nxc2, could have saved a lot: although d5, is still very winning...
moves.10... Bxc3+: luckily, finally Black - that would be moi - has woken up: so has White, and resigns immediately...
